[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/weighted_vuf/traits.rs] [Type: SecretKeyShare] [Memory safety] Do implementations properly zeroize SecretKeyShare and AugmentedSecretKeyShare on drop to prevent memory disclosure attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/weighted_vuf/traits.rs] [Type: ProofShare] [Size bounds] Are there bounds on ProofShare size to prevent memory exhaustion when collecting shares for aggregation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/weighted_vuf/traits.rs] [Trait: WeightedVUF] [Byzantine threshold] Does the overall WeightedVUF design maintain security with up to 1/3 Byzantine validators, or can edge cases in aggregation or verification allow smaller coalitions to break security? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/weighted_vuf/traits.rs] [Trait: WeightedVUF] [Quorum calculation] Are quorum requirements (2/3+ stake) enforced consistently across all functions (aggregate_shares, derive_eval, verify_proof), or can inconsistencies enable attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/weighted_vuf/traits.rs] [Trait: WeightedVUF] [Weight overflow] Can malicious weight values in WeightedConfigBlstrs cause integer overflow when calculating quorum thresholds, allowing minority coalitions to meet thresholds? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/weighted_vuf/traits.rs] [Comment line 30-31] [Stake threshold assumption] The comment states 'more than 33% of the stake must've contributed' for Evaluations - is this enforced cryptographically or just assumed, and can it be violated? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/weighted_vuf/traits.rs] [Trait: WeightedVUF] [Unpredictability guarantee] Can a coalition of validators predict future Evaluations before they are revealed, enabling front-running attacks on leader election or randomness beacons? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/weighted_vuf/traits.rs] [Trait: WeightedVUF] [Bias resistance] Can Byzantine validators bias the distribution of Evaluations toward favorable values by selectively contributing or withholding shares? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/weighted_vuf/traits.rs] [Trait: WeightedVUF] [Uniqueness property] Does each message have a unique Evaluation output, or can different share combinations for the same message produce different evaluations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/weighted_vuf/traits.rs] [Function: create_share()] [Empty message handling] What happens when msg parameter is an empty slice - does it create a valid ProofShare or should it be rejected as invalid input? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/weighted_vuf/traits.rs] [Function: verify_share()] [Null parameter handling] Can PublicParameters be constructed as 'empty' or 'null', and would such parameters cause verify_share() to incorrectly accept all proofs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/weighted_vuf/traits.rs] [Function: aggregate_shares()] [Maximum share limit] Is there a maximum limit on the number of shares in apks_and_proofs, or can unbounded vectors cause memory exhaustion or computational DoS? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/weighted_vuf/traits.rs] [Function: derive_eval()] [All-None APKs] What happens if all entries in the apks vector are None - does derive_eval() fail gracefully or produce a dangerous default Evaluation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/weighted_vuf/traits.rs] [Function: verify_proof()] [Malformed Proof] Does verify_proof() handle malformed or corrupted Proof objects safely, or can malformed proofs cause panics or undefined behavior? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/weighted_vuf/traits.rs] [Trait: WeightedVUF] [Domain separation] Is there cryptographic domain separation between different uses of the VUF (e.g., different epochs, different protocols), preventing cross-context attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/weighted_vuf/traits.rs] [Trait: WeightedVUF] [PublicParameters binding] Are all cryptographic operations cryptographically bound to their PublicParameters, preventing mixing of parameters across different security domains? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/weighted_vuf/traits.rs] [Trait: WeightedVUF] [Message commitment] Do Proofs commit to the complete message content including length, preventing length extension or truncation attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/weighted_vuf/traits.rs] [Function: derive_eval()] [ThreadPool sharing] Can sharing a ThreadPool reference across multiple derive_eval() calls cause state pollution or data races in parallel verification operations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/weighted_vuf/traits.rs] [Function: derive_eval()] [Panic propagation] If a worker thread in the ThreadPool panics during derive_eval(), does it properly propagate the error or silently fail causing incorrect Evaluation derivation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/weighted_vuf/traits.rs] [Type: AugmentedPubKeyShare] [Send/Sync bounds] Are Send and Sync bounds properly enforced on AugmentedPubKeyShare when used with ThreadPool, preventing data races across threads? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/weighted_vuf/traits.rs] [Trait: WeightedVUF] [Backward compatibility] When upgrading WeightedVUF implementations, can old Proofs be validated with new code and vice versa, or can upgrade transitions cause validation failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/weighted_vuf/traits.rs] [Type: PublicParameters] [Parameter versioning] Is there versioning in PublicParameters to prevent mixing of different cryptographic parameter sets across upgrades? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/weighted_vuf/traits.rs] [Trait: WeightedVUF] [Migration safety] During epoch transitions with validator set changes, can inconsistent WeightedConfigBlstrs cause proof verification failures or consensus stalls? (High)

(Medium)
